title: Tyke
author: Tyke
content: #Bitcoin 2008/09-2022 History Book! ðŸ“™If you wish to read the most important events in #BTC s history (14 yearly chapters), please support me:$BTC 1AeYQnpEqxAV4LdrFE5AzquqheTekLNggxWork in Progress! ðŸ’»#DigiByte #Syscoin #Groestlcoin #Litecoinhttps://twitter.com/CryptoBooksAlt/status/1574823015602425872I have researched and written about a multitude of different cryptocurrencies since 2014. I will do my utmost to include as much #Bitcoin history as possible......major blockchain events, exchange additions, price metrics, wallet upgrades, and much more!https://twitter.com/CryptoBooksAlt/status/1574823698867130380

comments.author: sashOG
comments.body: Hey Tyke nice to talk to you.I want to tell you a crazy story. No one has ever for a second or moment just for fun had thought that Satoshi simply forgot password I mean it happend to a lot of passwords for wallet but the one I am talking about is for this forum. The place where all started. Who is Satoshi doesn't matter Satoshi Nakamoto is just an idea of a person. Everyone think its person from Japan if you look at Satoshi profile it doesnt have location name is clearly an alias because he wanted to stay unknown. He just had ideas to share and was nice to people. HE ACTUALLY DIDN'T CODE A THING FOR BITCOIN. HE WAS A MAN WITH IDEA. He didn't command he would just comment on peoples ideas. The place was a mess. He was just a voice of reason in a crazy time. Such crazy time is now. When everything went downhill he just said this might work guys lets try this. Real colaboration is when you share credit. The white paper maybe wasn't his but was needed to be claimed for the sake of the greater good for a moment. Proof he didn't want to be hardcoded an bitcoin wallet adress to be paid. He was just doing this for ideal. Everyone thinks that Satoshi is the holder of the greatest wallet but that doesn't have to mean it's true. Investiaget movement of the forum. There is a reason that no one can have a satoshi in nick. if he lost password he couldnt possibly help others with the work.There is possibility that he didn't see himself as a very significant figure maybe he had personal stuff to do other work that needed to be done. Just because he was nice everyoneÂ  wanted to talk with him. Man had great kindness in a crazy word. Everyone had thought of him as a leader. EVERYONE BUT HIMSELF. Real world is not virtual like on the internet. If you are interested we can talk more.Satoshi

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Do you plan on compiling it into a book eventually and selling it on somewhere like Amazon or perhaps your own website you make in the future?Quote from: sashOG on October 06, 2022, 05:49:26 PMI want to tell you a crazy story.It's just what you say it is, a [fiction] story.

comments.author: serhack
comments.body: My article highlights a very particular moment in Bitcoin History. The idea is nice, but please give more details so reader can fully understand what product you're selling.https://serhack.me/articles/story-behind-alternative-genesis-block-bitcoin/

comments.author: sashOG
comments.body: Listen I am not after fame I will comunicate only through this forum because I know its secure.Contact admin from 2009 I know exactly what happend and the mistery behind 4 missing pages. WE HAD A DEAL only two people know the deal he can confirm my story.Relocation happend because of security Satoshi moved people from one forum to another to secure anonymity to anyone that wants it. 2014 happend when fool claimed he is Satoshi. But Satoshi is not one person. EVERYONE THAT CONTRIBUTED IS SATOSHI.I just want to help develop BTC FURTHER i am just a man with a vision doesnt matter if my nick is satoshi or sashOG

comments.author: Tyke
comments.body: I am still researching Bitcoin history from 2008/09 to 2022. Here is my recent tweet:https://twitter.com/CryptoBooksAlt/status/1588249569007407104Please retweet & like.Â  I am looking for people to sponsor the book.Â  Please contact me if you'd like to.Â  I've already collected together notes of Bitcoin history from 2008/09 to 2013.Â  I will post regular tweets as I progress.

comments.author: Tyke
comments.body: What does the Bitcoin community think? Looking forward to engagement and constructive support â€¦

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: Tyke on November 23, 2022, 08:59:49 PMWhat does the Bitcoin community think? Looking forward to engagement and constructive support â€¦ I think you are wasting your time and energy with shitcoins like DigiByte, Syscoin and others you mentioned, but it's your project and you can do whatever you want.Current market conditions are not great and people are more interested in current market conditions then past events, that can be distorted with different points of view.You need to understand that people are not willing to send donations and make sponsorship for any Bitcoin related books easy, except maybe for faces that are already known in public like Andreas Antonopoulos etc.Anyway, good luck with your project, and remember to mention Bitcointalk forum as important part of Bitcoin history

comments.author: Tyke
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on November 23, 2022, 09:33:33 PMQuote from: Tyke on November 23, 2022, 08:59:49 PMWhat does the Bitcoin community think? Looking forward to engagement and constructive support â€¦ I think you are wasting your time and energy with shitcoins like DigiByte, Syscoin and others you mentioned, but it's your project and you can do whatever you want.Current market conditions are not great and people are more interested in current market conditions then past events, that can be distorted with different points of view.You need to understand that people are not willing to send donations and make sponsorship for any Bitcoin related books easy, except maybe for faces that are already known in public like Andreas Antonopoulos etc.Anyway, good luck with your project, and remember to mention Bitcointalk forum as important part of Bitcoin history Thank you for your reply
